data.scheme_name: Enhancement of Competitiveness in the Indian Capital Goods Sector - Common Engineering Facility Centres - NYI
data.benefits: Scheme provides grant up to 80% of cost of creation of equipment, machinery hardware and software facilities.
data.eligibility: Private entities engaged in research and development.
data.conditions:
Funding shall be provided only for the development of new technologies.
It is mandatory for all applicants to register on the MHI Technology Innovation Platforms set up under the 
MHI CG Scheme.
data.beneficiaries: Private industries engaged in research and development and training.
data.prerequisites:
It is mandatory for all applicants to register on the MHI Technology Innovation Platforms set up under the MHI CG Scheme.
No grant given by Government of India under any Scheme/ Programme shall be used for this purpose.
Grant will not be given for meeting the cost of land and building.
The Project Implementing Organisation shall not dispose of or lease out or create any charge over the assets created by utilizing the 
assistance provided under this scheme, without written permission from the MHI
data.context: This scheme is introduced to provide greater impetus through creation of a strong and globally competitive capital goods sector that contributes at least 25% to the manufacturing sector.
data.objective: Objective of Centre of Excellence is to fulfil the needs of development of high risk futuristic technological projects like, high tech machine tool aggregates, controls, guides, motors, CNCs, high precision components, etc.
data.description: Government of India will be provide grant up to 80% of cost of creation of equipment, hardware and software facilities for Setting up of Common Engineering Facility Centres.
data.how_to_apply: The applicants shall submit application forms along with Detailed Project Report to Ministry of Heavy Industry.
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get the incentives after the approval of the concerned authority.
data.highlights: Applicants can apply through the link : https://smestreet.in/infocus/ministry-of-heavy-industries-year-end-review-2023-2051139
data.additional_info:
All PIOs shall open a new saving bank account in a public sector bank for the receipt of financial assistance from MHI.
The accounts of the PIO shall be audited every year and the PIO shall be required to submit annual 
financial statements to MHI, at the end of each financial year.
The PIO shall be required to maintain a fixed assets register of equipment/assets procured by utilizing 
grant funds for verification by MHI at any time.
